name: Dão White Reserva
review: A generous, full-bodied white, with apple cobbler, buttered pastry and slivered almond notes. Dried mango and baking spice accents are backed by firm but integrated acidity that lingers into the floral-infused finish. Drink now through 2018. 3,000 cases made.

name: Dão Reserva
review: A juicy red, with lively red currant, raspberry and cherry flavors, backed by crisp acidity. Floral notes show midpalate, leading to a fresh finish accented by roasted chestnut hints. Drink now through 2019. 13,852 cases made.

name: Encruzado Dão Reserva
review: Powerfully crisp and full of stony notes to the green apple, scallion and Bosc pear flavors. Offers intense notes of dried sage and tarragon, with a finish that has touches of cinnamon. Needs time to settle down. Best from 2018 through 2022. 8,085 cases made.

name: Dão White Reserva
review: This very crisp and savory white offers lots of white pepper notes, with intense grapefruit and green apple flavors. Citrus zest details show on the powerfully austere finish. Drink now through 2020. 2,620 cases made.

name: Encruzado Dão
review: This rich and languid white offers notes of ginger snap, with marzipan, membrillo and ripe apple flavors accompanied by a hint of dried fig. A white raspberry jelly element marks the finish. Drink now through 2015.

name: Encruzado Dão Reserva
review: Offers a buttery aroma, with lively flavors of ripe citrus, dried mango and white currant, featuring plenty of spice. Long, lush and rich on the finish. Drink now.

name: Dão
review: Concentrated flavors of dried meat and roasted plum emerge in this ripe, savory red. The spicy finish features notes of forest floor and porcini mushroom. Drink now through 2018. 24,551 cases made.

name: Dão
review: Presents a vividly fruity aroma, with flavors of blueberry, raspberry and cherry that are lithe and well-structured. Notes of humus and mushrooms lend this a seductively savory edge. Mineral and iron accents grace the finish. Drink now through 2017.

name: Dão White
review: A fruity and well-structured white, with apple, lavender, lemongrass and ripe apricot flavors. Displays a mouthcoating viscosity and a long finish of orange zest, pastry and lemon curd. Drink now through 2015.

name: Dão White Reserva
review: Shows good power to the glazed citrus, ripe honeydew melon and baked apple flavors. The spicy finish features some buttery notes, backed up by fresh acidity. Drink now through 2013. 1,250 cases made.

name: Dão
review: Lush, with loads of plum and berry flavors and delicious sweet cherry notes. Well-structured, with a finish of dark chocolate and orange peel. Drink now through 2008. 600 cases imported.

name: Dão White
review: A savory white, with an open-knit texture, featuring dried apple and peach flavors, flanked by almond skin and spice accents. Offers a crisp finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Priorat L'Ermita
review: This powerful red is packed with ripe cherry and plum flavors, with alluring wild herb and mineral notes. Focused and harmonious, with well-integrated tannins and juicy acidity. An impressive balance of muscle and grace.Non-blind L'Ermita vertical (May 2013). Best from 2016 through 2029. 100 cases made.

name: Priorat L'Ermita
review: Such a powerful mouthful of wine that after swallowing, it's almost hard to talk. Explosively aromatic, with jam, tar, licorice and exotic spices, it leads with concentrated fruit, then follows with a sledgehammer of polished tannins that somehow dissolve on the finish, where the fruit reemerges like a rainbow. With a slab of well-aged, chargrilled beef--paradise. Drink now through 2005. 450 cases made.

name: Priorat L'Ermita
review: This red is at a lovely stage in its evolution, still exuberantly fresh, but showing serious complexity. Expressive flavors of cherry, raspberry, garrigue and mineral mingle over firm tannins, kept lively by fresh acidity. Focused, harmonious and long.Non-blind L'Ermita vertical (May 2013). Drink now through 2026.

name: Priorat L'Ermita
review: Irresistible fruit meets immovable structure. It'srare that such a juicy, ripe fruit-bomb, lush withblackberry and blueberry flavors, is also soconcentrated and well structured, but this richred effortlessly marries power and grace. Abenchmark for the appellation. Drink now through 2010. 300 cases made.

name: Priorat L'Ermita
review: This red is rich with berry, cream and vanilla flavors, showing lively touches of herb and citrus. Shows a sweet, fruity character but maintains enough acidity for balance, remaining focused and graceful overall, with an underlying minerality and a long finish. Drink now through 2021. 120 cases made.

name: Priorat Finca Dofí
review: Rich and mouthcoating, packed with jammy fruit flavors of blackberry and black raspberry, with chocolate and coffee oak notes and accents of wild herbs and licorice. Muscular tannins lurk beneath the plush texture and there's just enough acidity to keep it fresh and balanced. Best from 2007 through 2015. 150 cases imported.

name: Priorat Finca Dofí
review: Seamless. This red is a beautiful combination of ripe fruit, powerful structure and polished texture. Lush flavors of blackberries and plums are supported by firm, ripe tannins and give way to coffee and mineral notes on the long finish. Drink now through 2010. 1,200 cases made.

name: Priorat L'Ermita
review: This tender red is seamless and harmonious, with fresh, lively flavors of cherry, raspberry and vanilla, deepened by notes of garrigue and mineral. More seductive than powerful, offering plenty of depth. Drink now through 2020.

name: Priorat L'Ermita
review: Bright and juicy, this red brims with blackberry and raspberry fruit, accented by smoke, mineral and floral notes. It's tender and fresh, yet has enough tannins for grip. Not a powerhouse, but just sings through the finish. Drink now through 2015. 200 cases made.

name: Priorat L'Ermita
review: Perfumed and delicate, yet deep and powerful. Floral and berry aromas give way to black cherry, mineral and cocoa flavors, and the texture is firm yet tender. This red shows a firm structure and excellent focus. Tight, so decant. Best from 2008 through 2015. 30 cases imported.

name: Priorat L'Ermita
review: This big red draws you in with flavors of coffee, plum, blackberry and tobacco, then turns powerful on the palate, with muscular tannins and plenty of extract. It needs some time in the bottle, but will sing when it's tamed. Best after 2003. 500 cases made.

name: Priorat L'Ermita
review: Rich yet polished, this mouthfilling red adds the chocolate and coffee flavors of new-oak aging to the region's ripe, rich flavors of raspberries and plums. Already harmonious, but should expand and soften starting around 2000. 450 cases made.

name: Priorat Finca Dofí
review: This intense red hides extraordinary concentration under a smooth, polished surface. The tannins are dominating, but the longer you chew them, the more fruit emerges, ripe and complex, with plum, cassis and blackberry notes. Has the power of vintage Port, with marginally less alcohol. Best from 2000 through 2010. 1,200 cases made.

name: Priorat L'Ermita
review: This red shows lovely freshness, bursting with cherry, floral, vanilla and spice flavors. Not muscular, but juicy and generous, focused and long, more sweet than savory.Non-blind L'Ermita vertical (May 2013). Drink now through 2020.

name: Priorat L'Ermita
review: This fragrant red shows both elegance and intensity. Floral and berry aromas carry through on the focused palate, picking up flavors of mineral, vanilla and allspice that float over firmly etched tannins, then linger on the finish. This is as graceful as a ballerina. Drink now through 2012. 30 cases imported.

name: Priorat L'Ermita
review: Plush on the midpalate yet firm on the finish, this concentrated Spanish red delivers plenty of ripe fruit and toasty oak, balanced and rich. International style in its texture and polish, yet the flavors are distinctive and typical for the region. Best after 2003. 50 cases imported.

name: Priorat Les Terrasses Velles Vinyes
review: Graceful and harmonious, this red shows good depth, balancing juicy cherry and berry flavors with notes of vanilla, mountain herb and mineral. Light tannins and juicy acidity impart focus. Drink now through 2022. 12,000 cases made.

name: Priorat Les Terrasses Velles Vinyes
review: A light texture carries racy, intense flavors in this expressive red, with bright cherry, licorice, mineral, garrigue and spice notes mingling over light tannins and buoyed by lively acidity. Balanced, focused and elegant, with a lingering finish. Drink now through 2021. 12,000 cases made.

name: Priorat Finca Dofí
review: Polished and restrained, this red offers black cherry, pomegranate, smoky and mineral flavors, supported by light tannins and firm acidity. Not showy, but harmonious and lively. Drink now through 2024. 1,750 cases made.

name: Priorat Finca Dofí
review: Leafy and licorice notes frame black cherry, red plum and mineral flavors in this lively red, which is juicy and refreshing, with good focus. Graceful, balanced and long, with light tannins and fresh acidity giving energy and balance. Drink now through 2022. 1,175 cases made.

name: Priorat Finca Dofí
review: Black cherry, licorice, leafy, spice and cola flavors mingle in this fresh, focused red. The lean structure disguises depth and concentration. Lively acidity drives the spicy, floral finish. Drink now through 2022. 1,500 cases made.

name: Priorat Finca Dofí
review: This expressive red delivers intensity with finesse. It's quite supple, yet the berry, garrigue, licorice and mineral flavors are focused and harmonious, and linger on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 1,300 cases made.

name: Priorat Finca Dofí
review: Seductive. This inky red is rich with velvety blackberry and cassis flavors. Concentrated, it shows excellent balance and even finesse, with plenty of fruit on the long finish. Drink now through 2010.

name: Priorat Finca Dofí
review: A good balance of ripeness and crispness gives definition to this powerful red. Raspberry and cassis flavors are clean and firm, backed by powerful tannins and high alcohol. It's aromatic and long on the finish, but needs time to harmonize and reach its full potential. Best from 2002 through 2010. 1,100 cases made.

name: Priorat Finca Dofí
review: A full-bodied Spanish red that attacks the palate with firm tannins and lively acidity, yet there's plenty of raspberry, blackberry and licorice flavors beneath and the finish is long and clean (and alcoholic). This dry red has the power and profile of a young vintage Port and needs until 2000 to show best. 1,165 cases made.

name: Priorat L'Ermita
review: Aromatic and alluring, this red shows an elegant style for the region. Blackberry, vanilla and mineral flavors are fresh and balanced; the tannins are ripe and well-integrated. Not a blockbuster, but has intensity and length. Drink now through 2009. 480 cases made.

name: Priorat L'Ermita
review: Elegant and focused, this firm, graceful red offers crisp black cherry and cassis flavors, with lead pencil and cigar box accents, much like a fine Bordeaux. Not a blockbuster, it's impressive for its excellent backbone and definition. Best after 2002. 550 cases made.

name: Priorat Les Terrasses
review: Dense, rich and smooth, this polished red offers ripe blackberry, roasted plum, dark chocolate, licorice and tobacco flavors over ripe tannins. So plush and harmonious it's easy to overlook the complexity and concentration. Drink now through 2012. 2,500 cases imported.

name: Priorat Finca Dofí
review: Floral, cherry and forest floor notes mingle in this supple red. Fresh and balanced, with light, firm tannins and an alluring savory finish. Graceful, but has real drive. Drink now through 2014. 1,250 cases made.

name: Priorat Finca Dofí
review: Cherry and plum flavors are ripe and juicy in this lively red, which has firm tannins and light accents of tobacco and herbs. Balanced, fresh and clean. Tight now, but promising depth with age. Best from 2011 through 2018.

name: Priorat Finca Dofí
review: This big red shows an impeccable balance of ripe fruit, firm tannins and smoky oak. It's full-bodied but seems to float on the palate, carrying notes of roses, vanilla, chocolate and spices. It's subtle, but grows on you quickly. Drink now through 2007. 1,200 cases made.

name: Priorat L'Ermita
review: This red shows the tension and elegance typical of L'Ermita, but in a lighter style. Aromatic, with floral and herb notes, this offers pretty berry and spice flavors supported by firm tannins. The finish is long and clean.Non-blind L'Ermita vertical (May 2013). Drink now through 2018. 63 cases made.

name: Priorat Les Terrasses Velles Vinyes
review: Firm and focused, this red shows a beam of cherry and berry flavors, accented by mountain herb and toast notes. The tannins are assertive, but fresh acidity keeps this lively through the floral finish. Drink now through 2022. 9,000 cases made.

name: Priorat Camins del Priorat
review: This silky red offers fresh plum, cherry and mineral flavors, with light tannins and fresh acidity. The fruity finish exhibits a floral touch. Drink now through 2019. 20,000 cases made.

name: Priorat Finca Dofí
review: Black cherry, smoke, mineral and garrigue notes mingle in this harmonious red, whose polished texture shows a good balance of acidity and light, firm tannins. Not muscular, but intense. Drink now through 2017. 1,200 cases made.

name: Priorat Finca Dofí
review: A solid red, with lovely aromas of mountain herbs, smoke and blackberry that give way to dense tannins that shadow plum, coffee and tobacco flavors. Best from 2009 through 2015. 250 cases imported.

name: Priorat Finca Dofí
review: This plush red shows alluring raspberry and licorice flavors. Thick and sweet, it has good concentration and well-integrated tannins. A crowd pleaser. Drink now through 2010. 2,000 cases made.

name: Priorat L'Ermita
review: Polished, with vivid, alluring flavors of blueberry, blackberry and vanilla. Tannins are firm and well-integrated, and the finish echoes with floral, minty and smoky notes. Best after 2004. 350 cases made.

name: Priorat Les Terrasses
review: This fresh red offers lively flavors of red plum, licorice and mountain herb, backed by bright acidity and light tannins. Gentle and inviting, with good focus and deceptive depth. Drink now through 2020. 12,000 cases made.

name: Priorat Les Terrasses
review: Aromatic, with floral and heather notes, this lithe red delivers berry, vanilla and mineral flavors that are fresh and sweet, with firm, well-integrated tannins and a lively finish. Drink now through 2020. 900 cases imported.

name: Priorat Les Terrasses
review: This supple, medium-bodied red offers berry, chocolate and savory flavors, with good balance and a fresh, floral finish. Not showy, but has grace and length. Drink now through 2014. 12,000 cases made.

name: Priorat Les Terrasses
review: This firm, focused red is subtle and pure, with understated flavors of cherry, mountain herb, smoke and mineral. Balanced but tight now. Best after 2010.

name: Priorat Les Terrasses
review: This plush red spills over with sweet cherry and berry flavors, accented by licorice, mountain herb and coffee. The tannins are firm, but the texture is fresh and lively. Drink now through 2014. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Priorat Les Terrasses
review: This silky red delivers black cherry, dark chocolate, mountain herb and mineral notes in a polished texture over firm tannins. Not showy, but focused and expressive. Drink now through 2011. 15,000 cases made.

name: Priorat Les Terrasses
review: This luscious red offers vanilla, rose and berry aromas that carry through on the creamy palate. Ripe tannins underpin the fruit, but melt into the mix. A spicy, floral finish brings you back for another sip. Drink now through 2007. 18,000 cases made.

name: Priorat Les Terrasses
review: Plenty of ripe, fresh fruit in this red, with flavors of black cherries, blackberries and plums, along with accents of toast and coffee. Yet it remains smooth and graceful on the palate, with well-integrated tannins and a long, fruity finish. Drink now through 2005. 9,500 cases made.

name: Priorat Les Terrasses Velles Vinyes
review: This medium-bodied red shows balance and drive, with cherry, berry, mountain herb and smoke notes, supported by firm, smooth tannins and fresh acidity. Compact and focused. Drink now through 2016. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Priorat Camins del
review: This crisp red is bursting with red cherry and berry flavors, sweetened with a bit of vanilla, but balanced with notes of mountain herbs and lead pencil. Not muscular, but has backbone. Drink now through 2014.

name: Priorat Camins del
review: Bright and sweet, this supple wine offers raspberry, cherry candy and vanilla flavors, with notes of licorice and wild herbs that add dimension. There's just enough tannins for balance. Drink now through 2012.

name: Priorat Camins del Priorat
review: This supple red has good energy, with vibrant acidity fueling the bright berry and cherry fruit. Fresh herb and vanilla accents add interest. Graceful and alluring. Drink now through 2022. 20,000 cases made.

name: Priorat Camins del Priorat
review: Tart cherry, grapey and smoky notes mingle in this supple red. Lively acidity drives the flavors, while light tannins give support. Fresh and focused, this imparts a pretty, lingering finish of berry and mineral. Drink now through 2020. 19,000 cases made.

name: Priorat Finca Dofí
review: Focused and vivid, with bright raspberry and kirsch flavors, plenty of vanilla from oak and full, well-integrated tannins. Drink now through 2010. 2,000 cases made.

name: Priorat Finca Dofí
review: Firm, focused and fruity, with generous, jammy plum and cherry aromas and flavors that keep pumping out the fruit through the finish. A graceful wine despite the flavor velocity and juicy character. Drink now.

name: Priorat Les Terrasses
review: Luscious texture and lavish oak mark this seductive red. A bit light on fruit but still appealing, with coffee, chocolate and spice flavors. Drink now through 2009. 20,000 cases made.

name: Priorat Les Terrasses
review: Crushed blackberries. This lush red is soft yet rich, with luscious blackberry and plum flavors, accented by chocolate. The tannins are round, yet unobtrusive. Not profound, but irresistible. Drink now through 2003. 15,000 cases made.

name: Priorat Les Terrasses
review: Supple yet intense, this red offers plenty of raspberry and black cherry flavors, with accents of cinnamon and toast. It has enough tannin to match with food, and a long, seductive finish. Drink now through 2004.

name: Priorat Les Terrasses Velles Vinyes
review: This plump red delivers fresh flavors of plum and black cherry, with subtle notes of smoke and herbs. Gentle tannins and light acidity keep this smooth and supple, maintaining good density throughout. Drink now through 2020. 12,000 cases made.

name: Priorat Camins del Priorat
review: Cocoa and toast notes accent black cherry and plum flavors in this sturdy red. Shows firm tannins supporting the ripe fruit, with enough acidity for liveliness. Drink now through 2016. 45,000 cases made.

name: Priorat Camins del Priorat
review: This lively red offers juicy fruit flavors of cherry, berry and pomegranate, with accents of vanilla, spice and garrigue. This is light, but shows bright acidity and just enough tannin for grip. Focused and fresh. Carinena, Garnacha and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2014. 20,000 cases made.

name: Priorat Les Terrasses
review: Vivid berry and vanilla flavors float through a muscular structure in this expressive red. It's a bit chunky, but retains its focus through a berry-scented finish. Best from 2005 through 2010. 18,000 cases made.

name: Priorat Les Terrasses
review: Well crafted, showing harmonious balance of clean, cherry flavors, firm, ripe tannins and fresh acidity. If it lacks exuberance, it promises smooth, long development. Drink now through 2005.

name: Priorat Finca Dofí
review: Young, tight and tannic, with spicy, vanilla-like aromas and good fruit flavors wrapped in a thick coat of tannins. Has enough style, flavor and length. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Fred
review: Vividly expressive, with clotted creamaccented black currant, blueberry and boysenberry flavors gaining momentum as they play against gently nubby tannins. Has presence and power, finishing with grace. Best from 2017 through 2025. 388 cases made.

name: William Ivey Columbia Valley
review: Focused, expressive and powerful, bursting with blueberry, black plum, cherry, floral and dark chocolate flavors that come together seamlessly on the long and layered finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2022. 624 cases made.

name: Night Owl Walla Walla Valley
review: Lithe and expressive, dripping with cherry, raspberry, cedar and tomato leaf flavors on a sleek frame, lingering easily on the refined, harmonious finish. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2023. 1,028 cases made.

name: Guy Anderson Columbia Valley
review: Crisp and lively, deftly balanced to push the ripe cherry and black currant flavors forward and shade them with pretty sage and green olive overtones. Comes together harmoniously on the extended finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Best from 2016 through 2021. 613 cases made.

name: Malbec Columbia Valley Gamache Vineyard
review: Supple, silky and appealingly balanced, offering dark, ripe berry flavors and hints of mint, poppy seed and caraway that add depth and interest as the finish lingers against fine tannins. Drink now through 2020. 198 cases made.

name: Night Owl Walla Walla Valley
review: Firm, focused and appealing for its mint-inflected dark berry and licorice flavors, persisting nicely against extrafine tannins on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2014 through 2019. 247 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Boushey Vineyard
review: Polished and vibrant, with acidity to balance the rich cherry and blackberry fruit character. This has intensity in an open texture and green olive notes that persist into a long and expressive finish. Drink now through 2019. 149 cases made.

name: Syrah-Grenache Yakima Valley Boushey Vineyard
review: Fresh and vibrant, this is distinctive for its mineral and white pepper accents around a lithe core of blackberry, finishing with polished tannins that let the finish linger enticingly. Drink now through 2017. 174 cases made.

name: Viognier Walla Walla Valley Sparrow Estate
review: Fresh and expansive, with vibrant juicy pear, grapefruit and creamy spice flavors that linger on the tangy finish. Drink now through 2014. 136 cases made.

name: Alden Mason Columbia Valley
review: Well-knit and focused, with floral black cherry and coffee bean aromas and trim, complex smoky plum and spiced licorice flavors. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2021. 550 cases made.

name: Anne Martin McCool Columbia Valley
review: Firm, coarse tannins surround a generous core of blackberry, black cherry, licorice and herb flavors that push against the texture into a long finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Best after 2018. 608 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley Owl And Crown Estate Reserve
review: Dark and spicy, with sandy tannins around a supple core of blackberry, cherry and black tea flavors, lingering effortlessly on the deftly balanced finish. Best from 2015 through 2020. 100 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley Owl And Crown Reserve
review: Ripe and rich, with black cherry, plum and black tea flavors. A hint of jasmine lingers on the supple finish. A softer style that sidesteps tannins. Drink now through 2019. 25 cases made.

name: Malbec Walla Walla Valley Amparo
review: Polished and expressive, with layers of blueberry, cranberry and green olive set on a sleek frame, finishing with a peppery note. Drink now through 2018. 214 cases made.

name: Night Owl Walla Walla Valley
review: Tightly focused and structured, with a core of minerally tannins and persistent black cherry, sweet anise and spice flavors. Finishes on a firm note. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Best after 2018. 760 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Boushey Vineyard
review: Balances plump boysenberry and orange zest flavors with a focused structure that emphasizes stony minerality and spice notes. Drink now through 2023. 240 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley Owl And Crown Estate Reserve
review: Focused and trim, with cherry and dusty herb aromas and well-built plum and espresso flavors that finish with firm tannins. Best after 2018. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Walla Walla Valley Owl and Crown Estate Reserve
review: Supple and velvety, with spicy nuances to the red cherry and black tea flavors, this is medium-weight, lingering on the refined finish. Drink now through 2020. 118 cases made.

name: Columbia Valley
review: Firm and focused, with a white pepper edge to the bright raspberry and cherry flavors, finishing with a mild grip of tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2014 through 2019. 369 cases made.

name: Night Owl Walla Walla Valley
review: Sleek and lively, appealing for its sassafras-accented red cherry and floral flavors, gliding easily into a deftly formed finish. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2019. 508 cases made.

name: Night Owl Walla Walla Valley
review: Firm in texture, with gritty tannins around a generous core of smoky, licorice-accented blackberry and cola flavors, persisting on the finish. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Best from 2015 through 2018. 413 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Fred
review: Taut and focused, with a distinctive mix of savory and stony minerality and accents of blueberry and dried herb. Best from 2019 through 2023. 252 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Fred
review: Broad and spicy, weaving roasted grain, pepper and smoke notes into the core of blackberry and thyme flavors. Has presence but needs time to soften. Best from 2018 through 2022. 631 cases made.

name: Viognier Walla Walla Valley Sparrow
review: Fresh and open-textured, with pear and floral flavors, hovering easily over refined tannins. Drink now through 2016. 145 cases made.

name: Viognier-Marsanne Yakima Valley Boushey Vineyard
review: Bright and tangy, with lively grapefruit accents to the pear and floral flavors, dancing through the finish with grace. Drink now through 2018. 149 cases made.

name: Grenache Yakima Valley Boushey Vineyard
review: Firm in texture, with black cherry and guava flavors on a fine-grained frame, lingering nicely. Drink now through 2020. 135 cases made.

name: Malbec Columbia Valley Gamache Vineyard
review: Lithe, focused and appealing for its red berry and plum flavors, gliding easily over well-buffed tannins into a lively finish. Drink now through 2018. 158 cases made.

name: Malbec Walla Walla Valley Amparo
review: Dark and peppery, with a slightly bitter edge to the ripe currant flavors, finishing with generosity. Drink now through 2015. 144 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Fred
review: Gamy notes weave through the red berry and spice flavors in this taut style, a mineral character informing the finish. Drink now through 2020. 543 cases made.

name: Syrah Walla Walla Valley Fred Estate
review: Crisp and tangy, with dark berry flavors shaded by dried herb and straw notes. Finishes with zing. Drink now through 2017. 368 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Boushey Vineyard
review: Broad and minerally, with crushed rock notes weaving through the dark berry and cherry flavors, finishing with an earthy accent and chewy tannins. Best after 2018. 175 cases made.

name: Viognier Walla Walla Valley Sparrow
review: A snappy white, with floral tangerine and fresh vanilla aromas accented by lively, easygoing flavors. Drink now. 287 cases made.

name: Malbec Columbia Valley
review: Fresh and vital, with juicy red berry and floral aromas and flavors, finishing with a grip of fine tannins. Balances best with juicy food. Drink now through 2016. 319 cases made.

name: Night Owl Walla Walla Valley
review: This lithe, lean style offers green oliveaccented berry and floral flavors on a fine-tuned frame, playing against soft tannins as the finish lingers. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2017. 142 cases made.

name: Viognier Columbia Valley
review: Crisp, with a firm grip around a sturdy core of pineapple and pear flavors. Drink now through 2014. 188 cases made.

name: Vi de la Terra de Mallorca ÀN
review: Smoky and herbal notes frame black cherry, licorice and espresso flavors in this savory red. Lively acidity and light, firm tannins give this a modest but balanced structure. A refreshing bitter finish lingers. Drink now through 2020. 1,666 cases made.

name: Vi de la Terra de Mallorca ÀN
review: Firm and focused, this red shows cherry, tobacco, cedar and spice flavors. Not a muscular wine, but shows balance and drive, with a finish of floral and spice details. Drink now through 2018. 1,700 cases made.

name: Viño de la Tierra Plá i Llevant de Mallo
review: Bold and alluring. This vibrant red is rich with sweet cherry, chocolate and coffee flavors, yet remains clean and fresh on the palate. The flavors are intense and the finish lingers. Cabernet Sauvignon and Callet. Drink now through 2004.

name: Vi de la Terra de Mallorca ÀN
review: Aromatic and graceful, this supple red offers lively berry, floral, spice and vanilla notes. Light-bodied, but showing good intensity and drive, with enough backbone to match with food. Drink now through 2014. 850 cases made.

name: Vi de la Terra de Mallorca ÀN/2
review: Alluring floral and spice aromas give way to cedar, herbal and menthol flavors in this distinctive red. Offers a pillowy texture, with soft tannins and gentle acidity. The flavors linger pleasantly. Callet, Mantonegre, Fogoneu and Syrah. Drink now through 2016. 16,700 cases made.

name: Vi de la Terra de Mallorca ÀN/2
review: Black cherry, licorice, tar and herbal flavors mingle in this savory red. Leans more on acidity than tannins for structure, finishing with a refreshing bitter note. Drink now through 2018. 16,666 cases made.

name: Vi de la Terra de Mallorca White Quíbia
review: This firm white offers a somewhat oxidized style, with savory notes of dried apple, ginger and blanched almond. Focused, with grapefruit acidity and a spicy finish. Premsal and Callet. Drink now through 2017. 3,333 cases made.

name: Vi de la Terra de Mallorca White Quíbia Falanis
review: This savory white offers earth, mineral and lanolin flavors, with a core of pear and melon notes. Shows some richness and firm, underlying acidity. Drink now through 2016. 2,500 cases made.

name: Vi de la Terra de Mallorca ÀN/2
review: This polished red delivers a beam of fresh cherry and berry fruit, framed by licorice, smoke and leafy notes. Light, firm tannins and brisk acidity keep it focused. Drink now. 12,500 cases made.

name: Vi de la Terra de Mallorca ÀN/2
review: This ripe red offers plum, fig pudding, chocolate and meat flavors in a thick texture. The tannins are firm, but good acidity keeps this lively. Can match hearty foods. Drink now through 2914. 12,500 cases made.

name: Vi de la Terra Illes Balears ÀN
review: Raspberry and cassis flavors are accented by a hint of cedar and spice in this balanced red. Lightly chewy tannins show on the modest finish. Drink now. 916 cases made.

name: Vi de la Terra Illes Balears ÀN/2
review: A hint of tobacco in this red adds some character to the black cherry and blackberry flavors, with lightly chewy tannins on the finish. Best after 2008. 10,000 cases imported.

name: Vi de la Terra Illes Balears Son Negre
review: This pleasant red displays flavors of plum, licorice and red currant. It's balanced and easy to drink. A hint of tar shows on the finish. Drink now.

name: Vi de Taule de Balears Àn negra
review: Toasty vanilla notes frame the cherry and berry fruit in this light, firm red. It's clean and has just enough grip for food. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Vi de la Terra Illes Balears White Quíbia
review: Fresh and clean, with vanilla and toast notes and just a hint of brioche. Has a modest finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley Carneros
review: Hard-edged, with smoky, charry oak and dried out fruit that ends with a tannic finish. 560 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Ripe and focused, with a solid beam of raspberry fruit laced with sweet spice, toast and fruitcake notes, folllowed by a juicy finish. Drink now. 9,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Mendoza
review: Shows notes of honeysuckle to the ripe pear and crisp green apple flavors. Hints of lemongrass emerge midpalate, leading to a finish accented by dried mint. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Medium-bodied, featuring plum tart and berry pie flavors, with notes of cocoa power. Finishes with allspice and some custardy accents. Drink now. 8,000 cases imported.

name: Tokaji Essencia
review: Like syrup, this supersweet, concentrated dessert wine coats both the glass and the palate. Youthful, with pure apricot, orange blossom and mineral aromas and flavors. As this seeps in, then finishes gracefully, a caramel accent lingers. Drink now through 2050. 20 cases made.

name: Tokaji Aszú 6 Puttonyos
review: An elegant style, this offers dried citrus, berry and spice notes that persist through the long finish. Hints of vanilla and coffee creep in, and the racy structure keeps this balanced and lively. Drink now through 2030. 1,690 cases made.

name: Tokaji Sweet Life
review: Light aromas of honey and orange blossom continue on the palate, where a mineral note joins the chorus. This is delicate and balanced, with a tangy finish. Drink now through 2015. 854 cases made.

name: Furmint Tokaji Istenhegy Vineyard
review: A late-harvest style, showing apricot, quince and orange peel notes. The firm structure keeps this focused, with a mineral element emerging on the finish. Has moderate length. Drink now through 2015. 355 cases made.

name: Furmint Tokaji
review: Off-dry, with apricot, floral, melon and lemon flavors. Rich, hinting at earth and celery notes on the finish. Drink now. 316 cases made.

name: Hárslevel  Tokaji
review: Flavors of straw and wax mark this rich white. Not expressive, but harmonious, lingering with a lemon accent on the finish. Drink now. 44 cases made.

name: Crémant de Bourgog
review: Well-balanced and fresh, with citrusy acidity, this offers a creamy mousse and subtle flavors of yellow pear, pickled ginger and dried apricot. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Côtes de Provence Rosé Eternel Paradis
review: A fresh, pure style, with white cherry and peach pit notes that stream through, backed by light herb and talc accents on the finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills
review: Lithe, inviting and refreshing, showing a sense of transparency to the fresh plum, guava and white pepper flavors, gliding easily into the delicately expressive finish. Offers elegance and persistence. Drink now through 2022. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills Élevée Vineyard
review: Light and expressive, layering cinnamon accents among the raspberry, rose petal and white pepper flavors on a sleek and polished frame. Lingers with ease and finesse. Drink now through 2022. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Dundee Hills
review: Taut, focused and sleek, with polished tannins around a core of blackberry, strawberry, floral and spice flavors, lingering easily on the refined finish. Needs cellaring to gain harmony. Best from 2017 through 2021. 150 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne Égali
review: This balanced, easy-drinking Champagne shows an apple overtone and flavors of pastry, pickled ginger and crushed white cherry. Lively. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Improbable Réserve
review: A class act from start to finish, this profound, inky-black, thick-textured, modern yet artisanal-styled red impresses with its impeccable balance. Includes chocolate, mocha, blackberries, plum. Ripe tannins, sweet fruit, long finish. Burgundy-based negociant Éric Texier scores again with a seductive, fabulous, polished cuvée. Best from 2005 through 2015. 200 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Vieilles Vignes
review: This offers loads of warm currant confiture, roasted plum and blackberry pâte de fruit flavors, liberally wrapped with roasted alder and juniper notes. The woodsy edge is easily absorbed by the fruit on the finish, with extra tobacco, tar and iron notes checking in for added measure. Impressive and ageworthy. Best from 2017 through 2030. 150 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Vieilles Vignes
review: A juicy, fruit-driven style, with layers of fig paste, raspberry coulis and plum reduction driving along, picking up a light pastis thread through the finish. A well-embedded graphite note gives this spine. Best from 2017 through 2028. 200 cases imported.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape White Vieilles Vignes
review: Showy, with juicy layers of fig, yellow apple, persimmon, nectarine and melon all backed by a note of green almond on the long, rich finish. Nice buried acidity keeps this going. Equal parts Bourboulenc and Clairette. Drink now through 2011. 100 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Vieilles Vignes
review: So sleek and clean, this full-bodied red combines beautifully spicy fruit, black currant, licorice and a touch of eucalyptus. Light-footed, it glides on the palate to a long and elegant finish. Seductive. Drink now through 2007. 1,220 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône St.-Julien en St.-Alban Domaine de Pergaud Vieille Serine
review: A fresh, pure style, with a racy feel to the black cherry and plum sauce notes that cruise through the violet- and tobacco-lined finish. A sanguine echo at the very end adds serious length. This opens nicely in the glass. Resembles a baby Côte-Rôtie. Syrah. Drink now through 2020. 415 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Vieilles Vignes
review: Bright and juicy, with a forward personality and tasty red fruit, licorice, floral and mineral notes that stay tangy on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 200 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône Brézème
review: Dark and winey, with a great sanguine note piercing through the core of raspberry ganache, melted licorice and sweet spice notes. The long, juicy finish has nice underlying grip. Drink now through 2010. 840 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône Brézème Domaine de Pergault
review: Broad and velvety in texture, with layers of dark, crushed plum, roasted fig and espresso held together by a tangy iron note. There's a lingering tobacco note on the smoldering finish. Drink now through 2011. 200 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône St.-Julien en St.-Alban
review: Plush-edged, with steeped plum and blackberry fruit melding with notes of ganache and black tea on the finish. An alluring incense note weaves throughout. Very suave. Syrah. Drink now through 2017. 665 cases made.

name: Marsanne Côtes du Rhône St.-Julien en St.-Alban Domaine de Pergaud
review: Lovely white peach, apricot and green plum notes stream through, with hints of paraffin, macadamia nut and citrus oil on the finish. Shows ripeness and tension. Drink now through 2016. 416 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Vieilles Vignes
review: Open-knit and very stylish, with red currant, plum, fruitcake and sweet spice notes backed by a concentrated but elegant, almost sleek finish. There's nice buried minerality. Drink now through 2018. 172 cases made.

name: Condrieu Vernon
review: Nice spice, ginger powder, persimmon and quince notes here, with a soft yet rich palate. Fruit picks up in intensity through the finish. Well done. Drink now through 2005. 75 cases imported.

name: Côte-Rôtie Vieilles Vignes
review: Offers concentration, but with a crisp edge to the violet, tobacco, black cherry and red plum notes. The long, tangy finish is very mineral-driven. Best from 2010 through 2016. 122 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône Brézème
review: Alluring, with dark cherry and blackberry fruit, inlaid with singed mesquite and pepper notes. A lovely iron thread adds length and a tangy hint to the finish. Drink now through 2016. 833 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages Chusclan
review: Racy, with mouthwatering acidity driving the red currant, red cherry, sandalwood and incense notes through the long, perfumy finish. A very restrained, pure style, with nice latent grip. Drink now through 2012. 350 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages Rasteau
review: Ripe, with fig and raspberry notes held together with a black tea hint. The fleshy, fruitcake-tinged finish is accessible now, but has good latent drive. Drink now through 2011. 200 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages Vaison-La-Romaine
review: Nicely focused, with a strong iron edge framing the black cherry, violet and spice notes. Stays mouthwatering on the finish, with lingering purity. Drink now through 2011. 500 cases made.

name: Roussanne Côtes du Rhône Brézème
review: Offers an alluring, creamy feel, with tasty apricot, nectarine and orange blossom notes. Reveals an almond tinge on the finish. A flattering style. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Roussanne Côtes du Rhône Brézème
review: Tasty, with an unctuous edge to the creamed melon and yellow apple fruit. Finish is laced with ginger and brioche, but stays fresh thanks to a quinine hint. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Vin de Table Français Nôble Rot Botrytis
review: Thick and intense with concentrated honey, baked apple, apricot and spice aromas and flavors backed by lively acidity and a long, lingering finish. Drink now through 2005.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Vieilles Vignes
review: Attractive. Very reserved aromatically, offering just a hint of mineral and pebbles, but in the palate it explodes with sensational ripe red and black fruit layered with spices and licorice. Firm but ripe tannins, and hints of chocolate, smoke and mocha, but in the end it's ripe fruit that comes back. Best from 2007 through 2020. 2,500 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Vieilles Vignes
review: A very fresh, high-pitched style, with red currant and damson plum fruit flavors pulled tight over sanguine, iron and white pepper notes. A bright savory edge gives the finish energy. Lovely purity and cut, though a bit shy on depth vis-à-vis some colleagues. Drink now through 2022. 75 cases imported.

name: Côte-Rôtie Vieilles Vignes
review: Bright and high-toned, with red fruit and floral notes backed by a bright, minerally spine. A touch crisp on the finish, but with good length. Drink now through 2014. 100 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône Brézème
review: A racy, pure style, showing tangy pepper and tobacco notes backed by iron, damson plum and red currant fruit flavors, with a silky finish. Drink now through 2011. 1,000 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône Brézème
review: This shows good mixed berry, herb and tobacco notes, with a lingering hint of violet and spice. Has a nice focused feel, with the emphasis on elegance. Drink now through 2009. 800 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône Chat Fou
review: Rich yet sleek overall, with a white pepper note gilding the core of steeped damson plum and cherry fruit. An iron thread emerges on the finish. Grenache, with Grenache Blanc, Roussanne and Clairette. Drink now through 2016. 1,500 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône White Adèle
review: Very fresh, with deliciously pure creamed melon and yellow apple fruit flavors that race along, highlighted by honeysuckle and heather notes. Clairette and Marsanne. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône White Brézème Domaine de Pergaud Vieille Roussette
review: Offers a ripe, flattering feel, with lots of warm piecrust and ginger notes out front, followed by creamed Cavaillon melon and glazed pear fruit flavors. Quince accents fill in on the finish. The profile is more reminiscent of Chenin Blanc than any Rhône varieties. Roussanne. Drink now. 50 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages Chusclan
review: Solid, with cassis bush, tobacco and red currant notes followed by a bright mineral hint that lends a tangy edge to the finish. Drink now through 2009. 500 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages Vaison-La-Romaine
review: A bright, racy, floral style, with delicious red currant and cherry fruit carried by mouthwatering acidity. Shows nice definition through the red licorice-tinged finish. Pure. Drink now through 2013. 2,000 cases made.

name: Vin de Table Opale
review: This is frankly sweet, but not at all heavy, with acacia and honeysuckle notes keeping this high-pitched, while ginger, yellow apple and candied lime notes fill in the core. A spätlese Viognier, if you will. Drink now. 333 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape White Vieilles Vignes
review: Like a well-made, medium-bodied Puligny-Montrachet. Shows buttery leesy, bread dough and toasted oak notes, mingling with a touch of honey and sparkling lemon on the finish. Gorgeous sweet fruit on the balanced finish. Drink now through 2005. 375 cases made.

name: Condrieu
review: Odd, with a limelike, woody, mineral and very citrusy character on the palate. There is an intensity in this medium-bodied white. Should go well as an aperitif, or with seafood. Should improve with age. Drink now through 2010. 400 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône
review: Ripe and supple, with lots of plum, currant, beef, licorice and graphite, backed by briar and pepper notes on the finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages St.-Gervais Vieilles Vignes des Cadinières
review: Pretty, with red and black cherry fruit mingling with spice and sandalwood hints. The finish is supple. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Viognier Côtes du Rhône
review: Light and bright, with green apple, lime and floral notes followed by a fresh, almost bracing finish. A very minerally expression of the grape. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône
review: Forward, with a mix of red currant, black cherry and mulled spice hints that glide through the silky finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône
review: Taut, with cedar, mineral and dried currant fruit notes backed by a coffee- and sanguine-tinged finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône Brézème
review: Fresh and spicy, with black cherry, hoisin sauce, graphite and licorice notes. Has nice length. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône St.-Julien en St.-Alban
review: Plum and cherry compote notes form the core, while light lavender and iron flavors fill in on the finish. Pure, sleek feel. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape White Vieilles Vignes
review: Rather honeyed, nutty style, with lots of orange curd, ginger, hazelnut and pie crust flavors. Loses some depth through the finish though, with just an echo of apple cider lingering; not flabby, but lacking some energy. Like a premox white Burgundy. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône Chat Fou
review: Direct, with blood orange and damson plum fruit notes imparting a slightly tangy feel, while sandalwood and tea flavors fill in on the finish. Drink now. 1,400 cases imported.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages St.-Gervais Vieilles Vignes des Cadinières
review: Full-bodied red with personality. Has iron, mineral character, and lots of licorice, black pepper, floral notes that are unusual in a Côtes du Rhône. Supple, sweet tannins, and a decadent truffle, mushroom flavor on the finish. Drink now through 2003. 840 cases made.

name: Viognier Côtes du Rhône
review: A touch trim for a Viognier, but with nice range to the melon rind, acacia and floral notes that are backed by a lightly crisp apple hint. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie Vieilles Vignes
review: Good black cherry and currant fruit, with firm mineral notes underneath. Turns tart in the end though. Drink now through 2005.

name: Côte-Rôtie Vieilles Vignes
review: Fruity style of Côte-Rôtie, lively and medium-bodied, offering some pretty blackberries, raspberries and cherries. Fresh citrus backbone on the lingering finish. Drink now through 2008. 320 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône
review: Light-weight, with a nice mix of juicy red and black cherry fruit backed by briar and spice notes on the finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages Séguret Vieilles Vignes
review: Smooth,ripe and succulent, this medium-bodied red is also a tad earthy, with freshly crushed black and red berries, a touch of smoke. Nice finish. Drink now through 2003. 1,210 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages St.-Gervais
review: Clean and succulent, medium-bodied red with roasted chestnuts, licorice, crushed red berries. Pleasant, slightly smoky finish. Drink now through 2003. 630 cases made.

name: Condrieu Janrode
review: A bit too woody. Anise, floral and mineral notes seduce you at the start; a crisp--even tart--medium-bodied white that provides plenty of jazzy, racy, citrusy character, with dried pineapple on the very long finish. Drink now through 2008. 100 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages Séguret Vieilles Vignes
review: Light with slightly grainy tannins, but good red and black cherry fruit and sweet spice notes as well. Drink now.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages Vaison La Romaine
review: Fruity and crisp. Medium-bodied, juicy and succulent, ripe and sweet on the palate, but with air it turns smooth and refined. Neatly made, showing the potential of Eric Texier, who tries to make Burgundy-style Rhône reds. Drink now through 2006. 1,830 cases made.

name: Mâcon-Bussières Non Filtré
review: Rich and gently oaky, with apple, honey and vanilla flavors on a round profile. Drink now.

name: St.-Joseph
review: Clean, focused red and black fruit, subtle oak accents, with ripe tannins. Medium-bodied, nothing overly complex, but a good wine to enjoy young. Nice '01 St.-Joseph. Drink now through 2004. 500 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages Chusclan
review: Ripe, clean and fun red; a good pizza wine. Tastes of milk chocolate and black cherry. Medium-bodied, the licorice notes come through on the finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape White Vieilles Vignes
review: Like a fudge caramel toffee ice cream; lots of yummy stuff, but where is the clean fruit you expect from a fine white wine? The oak scents dominate here and it falls a bit flat on the finish. Still, medium-bodied and round, with a popcorn, butter finish. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages Cairanne
review: Soft, supple and straightforward, offering easy plum and red berry flavors, with a wet earth component on the chewy finish. Drink now. 830 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages Laudun
review: Good fruit in this fresh, vibrant, medium-bodied red, but the tannins are tough on the chewy finish. Drink now through 2005. 625 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages St.-Gervais
review: Nice fruit in this little medium-bodied red. The tannins clamp up on the finish, but still clean and vibrant. Should go well with bistro fare. Drink now. 1,125 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône
review: Like a fruit cocktail, soft, pleasant and simple, but showing decent plum, caramel, chocolate, raspberry and toast notes. 16,665 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages St.-Gervais Vieilles Vignes des Cadinières
review: Disjointed. Medium-bodied, with mature flavors such as mushroom, truffle and forest underbrush. Turns tough on the finish. 1,080 cases made.

name: Roussannne Côtes du Rhône Brézème
review: Rather thick in texture, this creamy wine with quince jam and butterscotch notes is pleasant to a degree, but lacks some definition and delivers some blurred fruit notes. It turns slightly heavy on the finish, like a waffle soaked in butter. 175 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages Chusclan
review: Shows modest fruit, with toast, wet earth, dried herb and a slight green, vegetal character. Drying tannins on the finish. 2,830 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages Sablet Vieilles Vignes
review: Modest fruit, with an astringent mouthfeel due to drying, unripe tannins. 540 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône-Villages Séguret Vieilles Vignes
review: Shows modest fruit, with plum, milk, caramel and astringent tannins. Lacks freshness. 2,500 cases made.

name: Chablis Montée de Tonnerre
review: Beautiful texture makes for a divine drinking experience, but be forewarned this is oaky, with vanilla, butterscotch, toasted bread aromas and flavors. Full-bodied, it stays clean and fresh thanks to the excellent acidity of the '96 vintage. Much better than when previously reviewed. Best from 2000 through 2004.

name: Chablis Mont de Milieu
review: Soft yet lively, medium-bodied, delivering ripe tropical, pear and melon notes combined with spice and smoke complexity, with a superharmonious finish that goes on and on. Drink now through 2004. 205 cases made.

name: Chablis Montmains
review: Opulent and unctuous, sweet, ripe and lush, this full-bodied Chablis sails with grace, carrying its generous honey, ripe pear, vanilla, dried herbs and smoke flavors to a long-lasting finish. Drink now through 2000.

name: Chablis
review: As charming as village Chablis gets. This isn't a complex wine, just a tight, fruity, minerally Chardonnay that's pure and vibrant on a steely finish coated with honey. Drink now through 2000. 7,580 cases made.

name: Chablis Montmains
review: Rather opulent, but still showing a hard, slightly metallic undertone of citrusy acidity; this has minerally intensity and tastes more like a '96. Should be ready in a few years. Best from 2002 through 2006.

name: Chablis Vaillons
review: Like a Sauvignon Blanc, this has a gooseberry, floral and grassy notes, but after awhile it turns a bit hot and bitter. Medium-bodied. Drink now, chilled.

name: Chablis
review: This full-bodied village Chablis is of medium intensity, shows decent balance and flavors of lemon, honey and pear. Drink now.

name: Chablis Vaillons
review: Quaffable and juicy, this Chablis lacks some complexity but delivers succulent fruit of good ripeness. Drink now. 325 cases made.

name: Chablis Montée de Tonnerre
review: Clean, spicy style, a Chablis that has seen some oak seemingly, this mingles green apple, cream and butter notes with a slightly astringent finish. Best from 2000 through 2005. 1,330 cases made.

name: Chablis Montée de Tonnerre
review: Like liquid butter, palate-coating, with vibrant lemon and toasted spice notes. Finish is a bit hot. Seems disjointed overall.

name: Chablis Mont de Milieu
review: Starts out fine, with elegant aromas and flavors, but loses balance, turning slightly cooked in character.

name: Chablis Vaillons
review: Rather crisp, showing dried herb, grass and pronounced green apple flavors. Medium-bodied, with a tart, green finish.

name: Petit Chablis
review: Tastes unbalanced, with a buttery, green apple character and green tannins that are sharp.

name: Chablis Vaugiraut
review: Strange premier cru, showing mature colors, aromas and flavors. Slightly oxidized and rustic.

name: Chevalier-Montrachet
review: Impressive density that demonstrates it's a well-made grand cru. Opulent and succulent, it's full-bodied, sweet-tasting, ripe and wonderful, delivering a bounty of tropical fruit, toasted coconut and spice flavors. Quite intense but still subtle, it should age well past 2005.

name: Bâtard-Montrachet
review: A gigantic wine, with a fantastic concentration of fruit and wood. Has butter, butterscotch and masses of fruit aromas. Full-bodied, with superb, ripe tropical fruit flavors and a superlative finish. Drink through 1996.

name: Montrachet
review: A firm, tough and firmly textured '95 Montrachet. While steely, it's full-bodied and has plenty of fruit, even hints at a silky texture that should expand with age. Complex and layered, the wood seems more subtle in this bottle than in two bottles tasted last year. Kicks off like a rocket on the finish. Deeply satisfying, and you can taste the soil. Best after 2010.

name: Bienvenues-Bâtard-Montrachet
review: Deliciously well made. Full-bodied, tropical fruit-flavored and superbly balanced, it also boasts plenty of toasted bread and mineral notes. Thickly textured, it coats the mouth. Don't touch until around 2010, when it will have become a classically refined white Burgundy.

name: Montrachet
review: Both showy and refined. This opulent wine offers tons of toasted oak, spice, ripe fruit, butter and mineral flavors. Full-bodied and harmonious, it cascades to a long, smoky finish that's a bit hard; needs until around 1998 to smooth out.

name: Bâtard-Montrachet
review: This grows on you. Fresh and vivid, with floral, earthy notes. Quite tough now, its backbone of acidity and fruit will need time to come around. Good intensity and nice balance; a serious white wine with loads of concentration. The new oak is present, but offset well by the fruit. Very long finish. Collect this with patience.--Chardonnay Challenge.

name: Bienvenues-Bâtard-Montrachet
review: All dressed up and ready for a night on the town. A very buttery, butterscotch-flavored white that's grand in scope, bold and rich in flavor and lingering on the finish. It's thick, almost sweet, yet balanced nicely with fruity, fresh acidity. Combines elegance and richness at the same time.

name: Montrachet
review: Marvelously opulent in a refined style. Bursts with toasted oak, seems overdone and overly perfumed (rose petal, violet, sweetish notes), but this full-bodied white turns smooth and complex in contact with air, a good sign for its cellar-worthiness. Shows butter, butterscotch, pineapple, pear and lime. Don't touch for a long time. Best after 2010. 167 cases made.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Hameau de Blagny
review: This is almost meaty, there's so much substance here, boasting flavors of baked apple, lemon custard and baking spices. This is lush and broad, until the structure emerges on the finish, funneling the citrus and spice notes to a long conclusion. Best from 2012 through 2023. 83 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Combettes
review: Racy and bordering on tart, this white is also elegant and graceful. Attractive lemon, mineral and spice notes broaden on the finish. This bursts with energy and resonates on the lingering aftertaste. Needs time. Best from 2010 through 2020. 75 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Combettes
review: Super. Well crafted, with a ripe texture and lush character, showing an undercurrent of fresh fruit and citrus notes that mingle with the honey, mineral, toasted almond and coconut flavors. Medium- to full-bodied. Try after 2000.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Perrières
review: What class. Fresh and zesty as well as rich and opulent. Offers the spicy oak, tropical, pear and mineral flavors you find in many '95s. Full-bodied, with a long, slightly burning finish (from all that smoky oak). But cellar it until around 2005 and you'll be richly rewarded with an elegant, minerally, mature white Burgundy from one of the region's acknowledged masters.

name: Bâtard-Montrachet
review: Both powerful and subtle, medium-bodied, with lots of lemon and toasted oak, plus loads of fruit. Most impressive, it builds and builds on the palate, bursting with flavors on the very long finish. Needs time. Best from 2003 through 2010. 45 cases imported.

name: Bâtard-Montrachet
review: Outstanding, but still hard and tough, with compact fruit and exceptionally firm acidity. Don't touch it until 1997.

name: Bâtard-Montrachet
review: Complex, with an interplay of earth and fruitiness. Marked by ripe fig and pear flavors, and a bit of spicy saltiness that lingers on the finish. Burgundy.--Chardonnay Challenge. 75 cases made.

name: Bâtard-Montrachet
review: Intense and lively, with creamy butterscotch, toast, honey and pear flavors that are rich and complex, finishing with great length and echoing the flavors. Delicious from start to finish. Drink now through 1995. 60 cases made.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Champ Canet
review: Round and supple, sporting aromas and flavors of spring blossoms, peach and grapefruit. Spice and mineral elements add to this wine's complexity, and the balance is impeccable. The fine, lingering aftertaste features spice and stone. Drink now through 2021. 104 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Champ Canet
review: Flavorful, offering some bright floral, peach, apricot, almost Viognier-like flavors. Fairly crisp at first, it turned velvety with aeration, giving a lovely, silky feel on the palate. The toughest, greenest of the Sauzet Pulignys, try it after 2005.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Champ Canet
review: Bold and full of fruit flavor, this complex Puligny delivers a symphony of flavors, from pineapple and peach to vanilla, toast and hazelnut. Firm, almost chewy in texture, the richness lingering on the finish. Drinkable now. 560 cases made.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Champ Gain
review: Elegant, reserved even, with apple, lemon and crushed gravel notes wrapped tightly around a vibrant spine. Intense and long, with all the elements in place. This just needs time to integrate. Plenty in reserve. Best from 2009 through 2018. 50 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet La Garenne
review: A big, ripe, rich and thick premier cru, this ultrafull-bodied wine oozes with wet earth, floral, honey, salt, wet stone and butterscotch flavors. Sips like extra-virgin olive oil, but is kept clean by lime flavors on the slightly tart finish. Try after 2000.

name: Puligny-Montrachet La Garenne
review: A wild wine, with compact fruit structure and exciting flavors of lemon, apple, pineapple and white pepper; zingy acidity on the finish. Try now.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Combettes
review: Complex and engaging, with intense pear, spice, citrus, vanilla and butterscotch flavors in delicate layers. Has a sense of richness, and the flavors linger on a smooth, silky finish. Drink now. 180 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Combettes
review: Rich, mouthfilling, loaded with butterscotch, spice and vanilla around a so lid core of pear fruit, a beautifully crafted, concentrated, flavorful wine , firm and long.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Folatières
review: Like a fluffy lemon cake, this white offers detailed lemon, butter and mineral aromas and flavors. Well-balanced, with a restrained power, this has concentration and length. There's a fine smoke and stone aftertaste. Best from 2010 through 2020. 60 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Referts
review: Big and ripe, bursting with seductive tropical fruit, pear tart, spice and honey flavors. Full-bodied, with wonderful acidity and elegance, it kicks in on the long finish. Drink now.

name: Bâtard-Montrachet
review: A touch earthy and ever so slightly candied, it becomes increasingly complex and interesting, with chalky melon, fig, pear and apricot flavors, finishing with a spicy citrus aftertaste.--Chardonnay Challenge.

name: Bâtard-Montrachet
review: A crowd pleaser; charming, and delivers the goods. As smooth as they come, with silky texture and rich lemon, tropical, toasted oak, mineral and honey flavors. Full-bodied and ripe but still elegant. Ready to drink through 1998.

name: Chassagne-Montrachet
review: A great village wine, with a supple, ripe, well-balanced texture and character. Offers plenty of pineapple, citrus, pear and subtle oak shadings. Well made and of full body, it should be even better after 2000.

name: Chevalier-Montrachet
review: Substantial and ripe-tasting, full-bodied and bold, with peach and pear flavors, firm acidity and a vanilla note that lasts on the finish. Drink now through 1998.

name: Puligny-Montrachet
review: Magnificent--powerful yet racy. A classy, full-bodied village wine that's worth collecting. Tightly wound and hard now, it shows little on the nose except citrus, spice and wood. Long, succulent and intense finish. This is a serious '95, with the depth to last for years; try it after 2005 when the minerally, ripe fruit character will express itself.

name: Puligny-Montrachet
review: Beautifully balanced and focused, with earth, wood and fruit flavors mingli ng nicely on the palate. An earthy, slightly toasty aroma leads to apple, s pice, lemon and honey flavors in a firm structure of acid and extract.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Champ Canet
review: This rich, supple white shows a laser-like focus, with lemon, apple, floral and mineral flavors. Balanced on the racy side, revealing subtle oak nuances. Best from 2016 through 2025. 100 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Champ Canet
review: Rich and buttery, displaying lemon custard and floral aromas and flavors backed by a lively structure. Elegant and detailed, with a long finish of spice, butterscotch and cream. Drink now through 2016. 130 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Champ Gain
review: This white is round up front, ceding to its vibrant acidity as it crosses the palate. Lemon sorbet, lime zest and bread dough notes hold sway in the center. Mouthwatering finish. Best from 2012 through 2023. 88 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet La Garenne
review: A steely version, boasting peach, pear, lemon and mineral aromas and flavors that build to a lingering conclusion. Harmonious, with adequate structure and a grilled hazelnut and stone aftertaste. Best after 2012. 105 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet La Garenne
review: A delicious young white, from the acacia, lime blossom and hazelnut aromas and flavors to the long, mineral- and spice-tinged aftertaste. It's all underscored by a vibrant structure. Best from 2012 through 2024. 105 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet La Garenne
review: Smooth and creamy, evoking lemon pie, spice and hazelnut notes. The seamless structure adds to the cohesion, while quietly holding all the elements together. Has terrific length, with a citrus and spice aftertaste. Drink now through 2018. 60 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Folatières
review: A lightweight, graceful white, with well-proportioned floral, lemon cake, oak spice, apple and butterscotch flavors. Just needs time to pull itself together on the finish. Excellent length. Best from 2012 through 2020. 54 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Perrières
review: A subtle, medium-weight white, this evokes lime, butterscotch, apple and mineral flavors on a lean, taut frame. Shows precision and excellent length, echoing the mineral theme on the aftertaste. Best from 2013 through 2024. 63 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Perrières
review: Round and supple, with good underlying sizzle, setting the stage for lemon custard, hazelnut and stone aromas and flavors. It's all well-integrated and remains long on the finish. Best from 2010 through 2018. 80 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Referts
review: A sleek and elegant version, driven by vivid acidity that propels the lemon, apple, spice and mineral flavors to a lengthy conclusion. This is balanced, echoing citrus and spice details. Drink now through 2020. 70 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Referts
review: This offers weight and power, but also a taut structure underneath. Lemon tart, peach and mineral flavors persist in the dense texture as this remains long on the dry, chalky finish. Best from 2010 through 2016. 115 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Referts
review: Ripe, spicy and generous, with focused pear, pineapple, butter and vanilla aromas and flavors. The finish broadens and enriches against a firm layer of tight astringency. Drink now. 775 cases made.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Referts
review: A rich, packed-in style that's tight, flinty, concentrated and complex, with intense pear, citrus, melon and toasty vanilla and oak shadings. It's well balanced and delicate, and will probably mellow and soften in time. 100 cases imported.

name: Bâtard-Montrachet
review: The sort of clean wine that should only get better with age. For now it is tight and firm, offering lemongrass, smoke, apple and toasted oak, and is firm and minerally in the midpalate. Crisp and tough on the finish, but with time it will soften. Best from 2005 through 2010. 200 cases made.

name: Bâtard-Montrachet
review: This is tight and subtle for a grand cru, revealing its pear, honey and hazelnut flavors slowly as you sip it. Very elegant, balanced and harmonious, with no sharp edges but with a sense of restraint. Drinkable now.

name: Bienvenues-Bâtard-Montrachet
review: Extremely well crafted, both subtle and powerful, the sort of wine that shows its pedigree from start to finish. Wonderfully concentrated, boasting a silky core and lots of mineral, pear and lightly toasted oak flavors. Superb. Can age for years.

name: Chassagne-Montrachet
review: Lovely honey, pear, spice and earthy mineral flavors are rich, complex, deep and enticing, with a silky-smooth texture and hints of nutmeg and citrus on the finish. Tight, firm and ready to drink now. 125 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet
review: This has flesh, with lemon drop, apple, grapefruit and light pastry notes, all backed by lively acidity. An elegant profile, showing great balance and harmony, with excellent length. Best from 2012 through 2018. 410 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet
review: A textbook Puligny, elegant and silky in texture, offering lemon, toast and hazelnut flavors. Harmonious and balanced, with a succulence midpalate and a mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2014. 450 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Champ Canet
review: Lively, sleek and intense, showing toast, spice, white peach and lime flavors that build on the palate to a long aftertaste. Nicely integrated and multi-dimensional. Best from 2011 through 2023. 104 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Champ Canet
review: A lovely wine, with toasted oak, ripe fruit, mineral and spice flavors. Subtle, yet full-bodied, with a silky, seductive texture. Try after 1998.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Champ Canet
review: Tight and austere, with flinty pear, fig, vanilla and spice flavors that are concentrated and tannic, finishing with a touch of coarseness. It should be smoothed out by now. Drink now through 1995. 200 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Champ Canet
review: Beautifully defined toasty, buttery, caramel-tinged pear aromas and flavors , a luscious wine with effusive character, firm texture and a long, long fi nish. It just opens up from the first sip.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Combettes
review: A rich, creamy style, yet still lively and long, showing vanilla pastry and apple tart flavors, with touches of lemon and mineral. A bit hot on the finish, but shows fine potential. Best from 2013 through 2023. 83 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Folatières
review: Racy in character and built for aging. A firmly fruity and crisp Puligny with ample peach and pear flavors, a lively fresh finish and hints of butter and honey.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Referts
review: Sleek, yet juicy, with vibrant structure driving its lemon cake, apple and pastry flavors. This is balanced and long, offering a crisp, refreshing finish. Drink now through 2020. 88 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Referts
review: Clean lines mark this slim, taut, linear white. Lime, apple, hazelnut and mineral aromas and flavors get lift from the vivid structure. It all plays out on the crisp, limestone-inflected finish. Best from 2012 through 2020. 88 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Referts
review: Subtle and appealing. A fresh, fruity style, displaying lemon, mineral, vanilla and hazelnut aromas and flavors on a medium-bodied frame. It's lively and concentrated, with a lingering aftertaste of butterscotch. Drink now through 2009. 125 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Referts
review: Big and rich, but shows restraint. Strong lemon tart, toast and ripe apple aromas follow through on the palate. Full and firm on the finish. Drink now through 1995.

name: Bâtard-Montrachet
review: Harmonious grand cru, with everything in the right place. Round, silky texture is backed up by firm acidity and nice amounts of honey, fruit and spicy-smoky flavors. Unusually ripe and honeyed for this vintage. Tempting now; better around 1997.

name: Chassagne-Montrachet
review: There's density and depth here, though it remains elegant and stylish, with lime, acacia, vanilla and citrus tones. The bright acidity keeps this focused and long on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 128 cases imported.

name: Chassagne-Montrachet
review: A lean, firm style, offering citronella, mineral and savory flavors. Has good acidity and a distinctive stony quality, lingering nicely on the finish. Best from 2009 through 2014. 120 cases imported.

name: Chassagne-Montrachet
review: A rich, anise-scented white, with a creamy texture enveloping lemon, nectarine and peach notes. Harmonious, lingering nicely on the finish. Best from 2008 through 2016. 100 cases imported.

name: Chassagne-Montrachet
review: A graceful wine, with modest flavor intensity, but what is there has an impressive range, showing lemon, pineapple, pear, honey and spice aromas and flavors that broaden on the finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Chassagne-Montrachet
review: Firm and exciting, full of honey, coconut, apple and modest mineral notes. Built for aging; drink now through 1995.

name: Chevalier-Montrachet
review: A beautifully honeyed, ripe and full-bodied white Burgundy. Plenty of tropical fruit, pear, mineral and floral notes here to please the palate. It should develop some nice complexity; try in 1999.

name: Montrachet
review: Subtle yet rich apple, honey, vanilla and cream aromas and flavors, medium body, firm acidity and a long finish.

name: Puligny-Montrachet
review: Offers wonderful elegance and finesse. A full-bodied wine, with subtle aromas of pineapple, apple and vanilla, ripe apple and grapefruit flavors and very crisp acidity. Drink now through 1996.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Champ Canet
review: Wonderful, thick and clean. Pure, focused and also subtle, with lemon, honey and smoke character, delivering fresh fruit from start to finish, with a silky, round texture. A pleasure. Drink now through 2006. 130 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Champ Canet
review: Rich and powerful, with straw, apple and pineapple aromas and flavors, medium acidity and a short finish. Drinkable now.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Champ Canet
review: Tighter and a bit more austere than most Pulignys, with tightly packed pear, pineapple and spice aromas and flavors that come through nicely on the finish. Has the goods to continue developing. Drink now through 1997. 950 cases made.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Champ Gain
review: Still very young and unevolved, this white needs time for its apple, grapefruit, cherry pit and spice flavors to meld with the firm structure. There's ample richness and fine length. Best from 2012 through 2022. 88 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Champ Gain
review: So delicate it's translucent, yet this is punctuated with lemon, jasmine, white pepper and vanilla flavors. Gains richness midpalate, turning slightly hot on the finish. Needs time. Best from 2010 through 2018. 100 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Hameau de Blagny
review: Peach, tobacco and nutmeg notes get a lift from the acidity, keeping this white bright and elegant. Supple in texture, this glides to a citrus-tinged finish. Best from 2009 through 2016. 70 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Combettes
review: Some very nice ripe fruit in this medium-bodied, generous, delicious white. Spice, pear, honey, apple tart and dried fig complexity spin, and there's a lime-inspired finish that's long and satisfying. Drink now through 2004.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Combettes
review: Prototypical '96 with good mineral notes, lush texture and lots of acidity for a vibrant finish. Impressive concentration and thick midpalate bring out a velvety smoothness. The oak is overdone and strangely perfumey, giving an odd floral character disappeared somewhat after the wine was aired for 12 hours. Don't touch for a long time. Best after 2007. 775 cases made.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Combettes
review: Beautiful premier cru. Rich and vibrant, with outstanding honey, spice and lemon aromas and flavors. Full-bodied and ripe, with a long, harmonious finish. Try from 1997 to1999.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Combettes
review: Extremely clean and fresh, with crisp acidity and ultrafine character; honey, hazelnut and lemon flavors, with perfect proportions of fruit and acidity. Try now.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Combettes
review: Well crafted, with impressive use of new wood. Full-bodied, with intense tropical fruit, pineapple and butterscotch aromas, vanilla bean flavors and a lovely, long, flavorful, toasty finish. Drink now.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Perrières
review: Ripe and generous, with pretty pear, toast, lemon and spice flavors that are well focused and integratedl 0icking up a trace of mineral on the finish. Complex and intriguing, with lovely butterscotch notes. Drink now through 1995. 287 cases made.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Referts
review: A beam of fresh lemon, surrounded by apple and mineral flows through the silky texture in this classy white. Remains firm and harmonious, with a nice lingering aftertaste of mineral. Best from 2008 through 2014. 125 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Referts
review: A big, full-bodied premier cru. Pretty honey, lemon and tropical flavors and a surprising backbone of crisp-tasting citrus. Long, smoky finish. Drink now through 1999.

name: Bienvenues-Bâtard-Montrachet
review: Good intensity, with dried herb, spice, floral and new oakish aromas and flavors. Lacks a bit of integrated harmony but provides a full-throttle, full-bodied white Burgundy experience. Crisp finish. Best from 2002 through 2010. 65 cases made.

name: Chevalier-Montrachet
review: Ripe and oaky, showing marzipan, honey, toasted oak and pear tart character. Medium-bodied, with good intensity. Drink now through 2005. 100 cases made.

name: Puligny-Montrachet
review: Seductive white Burgundy. Clean and elegant despite the thick texture, there is plenty of fruit to balance the rather heavy toasted oak character. Full-bodied, it impresses with its velvety structure. Drink now through 2005. 450 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Hameau de Blagny
review: Gossamer in texture, offering vanilla, clove, nutmeg, apple and lemon flavors. Fresh and elegant, if lacking a little density on the follow-through. Drink now through 2018. 75 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Hameau de Blagny
review: This is silky, the better to show off its glazed apple, lemon pie and vanilla shadings. This has bracing acidity, but needs time to knit together. Best from 2013 through 2021. 95 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Hameau de Blagny
review: Sleek and well-toned, this white offers lemon and mineral flavors backed by a mouthwatering profile. Has moderate intensity, followed by a clean, kinetic finish. Best from 2008 through 2018. 75 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet La Garenne
